channel.title: --Pre-Algebra-7th-Grade--
channel.description:
I got my books today for middle school but it starts on September 4th.
i got a Pre-Algebra book but i don't get the math...
so can someone please help me with it ok ill lay down some questions.
Find each sum or difference.
1. 7 - 6 2. 9 + 2 3. 15 - 4
4. 11 + 8 5. 20 - 7 6. 32 + 8
(Yes I am bad at math)
Compare. Use >,<,or = to complete each statement.
14. 1 [] 0
Find each product or quotient.(since i dont have divison since d= divided by)
19. 36 d 2
25. 20 • 10
What is the difference of each point from zero on the number line?
31. [i]A[/i] 32. [table][tr][td][table][tr][td][i]B[/i][/td][/tr][/table][/td][/tr][/table]
33. [i]C[/i] 34. [i]D [/i]

dude find each sum or diffrence not 7-6=1

what?

item.title: --Pre-Algebra-7th-Grade--
item.dc:creator: @_Nirvana † Nirvana †
item.description:
@_Nirvana wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:5, topic:133865”]Erm dude, Thats Algebra? I thought algebra was the use of letters.

Maybe you need to know the definition of the word to know how it works?
Difference: The space between.

Ask your self right now, “How much is between 6 and 7?” - Now answer yourself, “1”.

Legit is right for everything he just stated, since I don’t really understand the last questions(I haven’t done that math in years) when you ask for help don’t push them away ;\

[quote author=akisboy32 link=topic=185138.msg1677296#msg1677296 date=1187222798]
HUH!
Thats 5th Grade AlGebra…
O yeah and heres something you need to know, The First people who used Al-Gebra were arabs.

[/quote]I expect to see proof, this sounds illogical.[/quote]

Eww epic fail they arent just letters they are pronumerals!

Read full topic

item.title: --Pre-Algebra-7th-Grade--
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

find the difference or sum

difference = MINUS ( - )
sum = PLUS ( + )

I don’t believe thats 7th grade prealgebra lol people learn that in 1st grade… and master the multiplication tables by 2nd grade… thats the U.S standard.

Read full topic

Maybe you need to know the definition of the word to know how it works?

Ask your self right now, “How much is between 6 and 7?” - Now answer yourself, “1”.
